channel.title: need your opinion on the lyrics of my song
channel.description:
hey guys, recently I've been working on my own songs after 3 years of covering other bands. here's my first lyrics for my song, need your opinions on it and suggestions would be cool
I Am Nothing
"Verse1"
I am Hated, Rejected! I am Tired of this I can't hear you anymore I am Nothing, no More!
"Chorus" no more abusing me no more lying to me my feelings are hungry for more all I see is deception all I feel is rejection
"Verse2" give me your feelings so I can step on them I'll give you my heart so you can break it
"Chorus" am so sick of your games you cannot see the pain that's inside of me ! you cannot understand my feelings I am nothing but a lifeless void
"Interlude + Solo"
"Verse3"
I am Hated, Rejected! I am Nothing, no More! I can't hear you anymore I am Nothing, no More!
"Chorus" no more abusing me no more lying to me my feelings are hungry for more all I see is deception all I feel is rejection
"Outro"

item.title: need your opinion on the lyrics of my song
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
intooblivion:

Gimme dem burgers gonna eat em all up
Gimme dem burgers don’t need no ketchup
Gimme dem burgers that’s all that I need
Gonna eat burger till I piss sesame seed

I bow to your lyrical awesomeness.

Read full topic
item.source: need your opinion on the lyrics of my song

item.title: need your opinion on the lyrics of my song
item.dc:creator: BrAndi
item.description:
My opinion:

The Verses and the chorus seem sincere, and I understand the emotion they are conveying. But verse 2 seems fabricated in context, as if artificially cynical, probably because the lyrical I first feels like a victim and ignored in the verse 1 and the chorus, and yet wants to destroy the exchange of emotion with the addressee in verse 2.

“Verse2”
give me your feelings
so I can step on them
I’ll give you my heart
so you can break it

This is by itself very interesting poetry. But I am confused as to what the lyrical I really wants. That is why verse 2 stands out and seems a bit hypocritical, almost artificially sinister, like a terrifying gothic castle on a blooming meadow on a beautiful summer day, the longing for emotion being the summer day and the castle being the cynicism.

The frequent use of “more” [e.g. ‘anymore’, ‘no more’] seemed repetitve at first but creates a very interesting effect. On the one hand the lyrical I is asking for the suffering to end, but the frequent use of the word ‘more’ that is very present when you read the poem aloud, contradicts this on the audible level.

Try changing verse 2 into a metaphor, e.g. to how everyone is sucking out positive emotions out of the lyrical I like a giant black hole of douchbaggery and self-loathing. Or change everything except verse 2 to, as has been proposed, how the lyrical I is going to kick the ass of the abusers.

Keep it up!

Read full topic

item.title: need your opinion on the lyrics of my song
item.dc:creator: Android11x
item.description:
from the beginning of the start I’ve always felt

the days flew past with the time and the daze

enjoying our lives, we were all in a haze

I know one day, I’ll get up, we’ll rise

but 'til then I won’t let the clock phase me

beer in hand and I let our gazes meet

you’ll feel good, she’ll feel right

we go home and our bodies touch, my feelings fly

the morning comes, the sun shines

we both go our separate ways, this is how it’s always been

from the beginning of the start I’ve always felt

the days flew past with the time and the daze

enjoying our lives, we were all in a haze

I know one day, I’ll get up, we’ll rise

but 'til then I won’t let the clock phase me

that sour taste in my mouth, rotten, dreary wake-ups

shake it off, tomorrow is soon, thoughts of brighter days—

make me swoon, regular habits and routine behaviors

indulge in food and chat with friends, up to date with usual trends

this is how it’s always been and will always be

I just made this and I MAY OR MAY NOT have had a few beverages, but regardless.

Read full topic

item.title: need your opinion on the lyrics of my song
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Angsty lyrics aren’t bad by default, the problem with these lyrics is that they’re super generic. They could have been written by any other emo kid. I don’t want to offend you Shadi, it’s just that they feel really shallow and unoriginal.

Read full topic
